WARNING.name: audit_experiment
WARNING.detail: Signal Portion of Tags (SPOT) is a measure of enrichment, analogous to the commonly used fraction of reads in peaks metric. ENCODE processed alignment files {ENCFF839SPF|/files/ENCFF839SPF/} produced by DNase-seq pipeline ( {ENCPL848KLD|/pipelines/ENCPL848KLD/} ) for GRCh38 assembly  have a SPOT1 score of 0.37. According to ENCODE standards, SPOT1 score of 0.4 or higher is considered a product of high quality data. Any sample with a SPOT1 score <0.3 should be targeted for replacement with a higher quality sample, and a SPOT1 score of 0.25 is considered minimally acceptable SPOT1 score of 0.25 is considered minimally acceptable for rare and hard to find primary tissues. (See {ENCODE DNase-seq data standards|/data-standards/dnase-seq/} )

ERROR.name: audit_experiment
ERROR.detail: Alignment file {ENCFF425WDA|/files/ENCFF425WDA/} produced by DNase-HS pipeline single-end - Version 2 ( {ENCPL201DNS|/pipelines/ENCPL201DNS/} ) for GRCh38 assembly has 17851592 mapped reads. According to ENCODE standards, conventional DNase-seq profile requires a minimum of 20 million uniquely mapped reads to generate a reliable SPOT (Signal Portion of Tags) score. The recommended value is > 50 million. For deep, foot-printing depth DNase-seq 150-200 million uniquely mapped reads are recommended. (See {ENCODE DNase-seq data standards|/data-standards/dnase-seq/} )

WARNING.name: audit_experiment
WARNING.detail: Signal Portion of Tags (SPOT) is a measure of enrichment, analogous to the commonly used fraction of reads in peaks metric. ENCODE processed alignment files {ENCFF020WZB|/files/ENCFF020WZB/} produced by DNase-HS pipeline single-end - Version 2 ( {ENCPL201DNS|/pipelines/ENCPL201DNS/} ) for GRCh38 assembly  have a SPOT1 score of 0.39. According to ENCODE standards, SPOT1 score of 0.4 or higher is considered a product of high quality data. Any sample with a SPOT1 score <0.3 should be targeted for replacement with a higher quality sample, and a SPOT1 score of 0.25 is considered minimally acceptable SPOT1 score of 0.25 is considered minimally acceptable for rare and hard to find primary tissues. (See {ENCODE DNase-seq data standards|/data-standards/dnase-seq/} )

WARNING.name: audit_experiment
WARNING.detail: Signal Portion of Tags (SPOT) is a measure of enrichment, analogous to the commonly used fraction of reads in peaks metric. ENCODE processed alignment files {ENCFF729UYK|/files/ENCFF729UYK/} produced by DNase-HS pipeline single-end - Version 2 ( {ENCPL201DNS|/pipelines/ENCPL201DNS/} ) for GRCh38 assembly  have a SPOT1 score of 0.36. According to ENCODE standards, SPOT1 score of 0.4 or higher is considered a product of high quality data. Any sample with a SPOT1 score <0.3 should be targeted for replacement with a higher quality sample, and a SPOT1 score of 0.25 is considered minimally acceptable SPOT1 score of 0.25 is considered minimally acceptable for rare and hard to find primary tissues. (See {ENCODE DNase-seq data standards|/data-standards/dnase-seq/} )
